meanings.sent1: She will adduce the witness's testimony in court.
meanings.sent2: He always adduces statistics to support his claims.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to adduce the cat's meow as evidence, but no one believed him.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer cleverly adduced the old photograph to make his case stronger.
meanings.sent5: In the debate, she adduced a compelling argument that left everyone speechless.

meanings.definition: Offer as a reason or argument.
meanings.sent1: You can adduce your busy schedule as a reason for not attending the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He will adduce his health issues as an excuse for missing work.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to adduce lack of sleep as a reason for failing the exam.
meanings.sent4: She adduced her love for animals as the main motivation behind her volunteer work.
meanings.sent5: The politician adduced public opinion polls to justify his policy decisions.
